meanings.definition: Organized or arranged in a way that is excessively rigid or detailed.
meanings.sent1: The overstructured schedule left no room for spontaneity.
meanings.sent2: The overstructured report contained unnecessary details.
meanings.sent3: The overstructured party planning made everything feel too formal.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an overstructured filing cabinet, unable to think freely.
meanings.sent5: The overstructured maze of rules was confusing to navigate.

meanings.definition: Having too many rules or regulations in place.
meanings.sent1: The overstructured school had strict dress codes.
meanings.sent2: The overstructured company policies stifled creativity.
meanings.sent3: The overstructured game had more rules than players could remember.
meanings.sent4: His life felt like an overstructured board game, with every move predetermined.
meanings.sent5: The overstructured government regulations made starting a business difficult.

meanings.definition: Characterized by an excessive amount of structure or organization.
meanings.sent1: The overstructured project plan had every minute accounted for.
meanings.sent2: The overstructured event had a strict timeline to follow.
meanings.sent3: The overstructured closet organization made finding clothes a chore.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an overstructured web, neatly categorized but lacking creativity.
meanings.sent5: The overstructured city layout made it hard to explore freely.
